original_sap_section_used.ends_at: 10.3. Vital Signs, Weight and Body Surface Area

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Clinical laboratory assessments include hematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis, and coagulation.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical laboratory tests: hematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both documents list the same high-level categories.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory samples will be collected according to the Schedule of Assessments (Section 11.1).
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical laboratory tests... will be performed within 3 days prior to Day 1 of each cycle.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP references the schedule; Original SAP implies collection by mentioning analysis.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory. Reported units and normal ranges are various among sites. Reported units will be converted to standard units, if applicable.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory for routine monitoring; however, data will be standardized to International System (SI) units for reporting and analysis.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both specify local laboratory analysis and standardization of units.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Hematology: Hematocrit, hemoglobin, white blood cell count, absolute neutrophil count (ANC), and platelets.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Hematology: hematocrit, hemoglobin, white blood cell count, absolute neutrophil count and platelets
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP 10.2 does not list parameters, but Generated SAP matches Protocol list exactly.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Clinical Chemistry: Albumin, alkaline phosphatase (ALP), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), blood urea nitrogen (BUN), calcium, chloride, creatine phosphokinase (CPK), creatine kinase-myocardial band (CK-MB) isoenzyme, total cholesterol, creatinine, creatinine clearance (CrCl) (estimated by Cockcroft-Gault formula, see Section 11.6), gamma-glutamyl transferase (GGT), glucose, lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), triglyceride, high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, phosphate, potassium, sodium, total bilirubin, direct bilirubin, total protein, and uric acid.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical chemistry: albumin, alkaline phosphatase, alanine aminotransferase, aspartate aminotransferase, blood urea nitrogen, calcium, chloride, creatine phosphokinase, creatine kinase-myocardial band isoenzyme, total cholesterol, creatinine, CrCl... gamma-glutamyl transferase, glucose, lactate dehydrogenase, triglyceride, high-density lipoprotein cholesterol, phosphate, potassium, sodium, total bilirubin, direct bilirubin, total protein, uric acid
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP 10.2 does not list parameters, but Generated SAP matches Protocol list exactly.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Urinalysis: Bilirubin, blood, glucose, ketones, leukocytes, nitrite, pH, protein, specific gravity, and urobilinogen via dipstick.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Urinalysis: bilirubin, blood, glucose, ketones, leukocytes (white blood cells), nitrite, pH, protein, specific gravity, urobilinogen
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP 10.2 does not list parameters, but Generated SAP matches Protocol list exactly.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters including microscopic urinalysis collected as qualitative format will be categorized into normal and abnormal
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Microscopic examination and 24-hour urine collection (for protein) will be performed if indicated.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: microscopic examination... 24 hour urine collection if indicated at Screening
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both mention microscopic urinalysis.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: coagulation
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Coagulation: Prothrombin time (PT) and prothrombin time international normalized ratio (INR) (for patients receiving aspirin).
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Coagulation: ... should perform prothrombin time and prothrombin time international normalized ratio tests.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP matches Protocol specifics.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The baseline value for all analyses will be the last non-missing value prior to the first infusion unless otherwise specified.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Baseline is defined in Section 4.2.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP cross-references its own definition section.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline... will be summarized... by... visit.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Post-baseline summaries will include all scheduled visits during the Induction Study Period (Cycles 1 through 6), Maintenance Study Period (Cycles 1 and every 3 cycles thereafter), and the End of Treatment (EOT) visit.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Consistent with visit-based summary requirement.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical chemistry, hematology, urinalysis and coagulation data will be presented in separate listings
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: All laboratory data will be included in the data listings.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both require listings for all data.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology... will be summarized using descriptive statistics
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Summaries of actual values and change from baseline will be provided for hematology and clinical chemistry.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches requirement for Hem/Chem.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized using descriptive statistics
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Coagulation and urinalysis results will be presented in data listings only.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP explicitly requires summaries for numeric urinalysis and coagulation; Generated SAP explicitly excludes them.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: summarized using descriptive statistics by treatment group, laboratory category, test parameter and visit.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory parameters will be summarized by treatment group and visit using descriptive statistics.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches grouping requirements.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline... will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Summaries will include both actual values and change from baseline values.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches requirement.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table. (Implies visit tables are scheduled only)
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: As established in Section 4.5, nominal visits will be used for these summaries. Only scheduled visits will be included in by-visit summaries.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Consistent with Original SAP's handling of unscheduled visits.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: according to CTCAE version 5.0.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory abnormalities will be graded according to the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 5.0, where applicable.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches version.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The number and percentage of patients with a result for each grade will be summarized... A shift table will be also produced... Only the most severe case... will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Shift tables will be used to summarize the number and percentage of patients by baseline category (Grade 0 through 4) versus the worst post-baseline category.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches the 'most severe case' (worst post-baseline) methodology.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Worst post-baseline value is defined as the most extreme CTCAE grade observed during the Whole Study Period (as defined in Section 4.2), including results from unscheduled assessments.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches inclusion of unscheduled visits for worst case.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Reported parameters with units that cannot be converted to standard units will be summarized separately using the original units.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: For parameters not covered by CTCAE grading, shift tables will cross-classify patients by baseline category (Low, Normal, High) relative to the laboratory reference range versus the worst post-baseline category.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP is silent on L/N/H shift tables for numeric parameters; this is an acceptable methodological addition.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Analyses will be performed separately for the "High" and "Low" directions when both are clinically relevant (e.g., potassium).
evaluation_table.reasoning: Acceptable methodological detail.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The number and percentage of patients with treatment-emergent laboratory abnormalities (defined as an increase in CTCAE grade from baseline) will be summarized by treatment group.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Acceptable definition for summarizing abnormalities.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The number and percentage of patients with a result for each grade will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Particular focus will be placed on Grade 3 or 4 abnormalities.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Consistent with standard reporting.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table. (Implies exclusion from visit tables)
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Unscheduled laboratory assessments will be excluded from by-visit summaries but will be included in the determination of the worst post-baseline values and in all listings.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches Original SAP logic.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: If multiple laboratory values are collected on the same study day, the value collected closest to the scheduled assessment time will be used for by-visit summaries.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Standard data handling rule, not contradictory.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: For the determination of the worst post-baseline value, the most extreme value among all results (scheduled or unscheduled) for that day will be used.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches Original SAP logic.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters including microscopic urinalysis collected as qualitative format will be categorized into normal and abnormal... and will be summarized in a shift table.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Original SAP requires shift tables for non-numeric urinalysis; Generated SAP puts them in listings only.
missing_from_generated_sap.reasoning: Generated SAP explicitly excludes this analysis.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: A shift table will be also produced by the Whole Study Period and each study period.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Original SAP requires shift tables for each study period (Induction, Maintenance); Generated SAP only specifies Whole Study Period.
missing_from_generated_sap.reasoning: Generated SAP omits the requirement for period-specific shift tables.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: Grades which are part numeric and part clinical input will be assigned based on the numeric portion only.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Specific rule for assigning CTCAE grades based on numeric portion is missing.
missing_from_generated_sap.reasoning: Generated SAP omits this specific grading instruction.

issues.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized using descriptive statistics
issues.generated_sap_text: Coagulation and urinalysis results will be presented in data listings only.
issues.why_they_conflict: Original SAP mandates summary statistics for coagulation and numeric urinalysis; Generated SAP explicitly restricts them to listings only.
issues.description: Generated SAP removes required summary analyses for coagulation and urinalysis.
issues.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP explicitly lists 'numeric urinalysis and coagulation' as parameters to be summarized with descriptive statistics. 2) Generated SAP explicitly states 'Coagulation and urinalysis results will be presented in data listings only.' 3) These statements are mutually exclusive. 4) This reduces the scope of safety reporting.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized
reverse_check.explanation: Generated SAP restricts coagulation and urinalysis to listings only.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters... will be summarized in a shift table.
reverse_check.explanation: Generated SAP restricts urinalysis to listings only, contradicting the shift table requirement.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: A shift table will be also produced by the Whole Study Period and each study period.
reverse_check.explanation: Generated SAP mentions Whole Study Period but is silent on 'each study period'. This is an omission, not a direct contradiction.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: Grades that require clinical input only will not be assigned to these parameters.
reverse_check.explanation: Generated SAP is silent on this rule.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.

extra_information_flagged.generated_sap_text: Lists of specific Hematology, Chemistry, and Urinalysis parameters
extra_information_flagged.reasoning: Original SAP 10.2 does not list parameters, but Generated SAP includes them correctly based on Protocol.

extra_information_flagged.generated_sap_text: For parameters not covered by CTCAE grading, shift tables will cross-classify patients by baseline category (Low, Normal, High)...
extra_information_flagged.reasoning: Original SAP is silent on this specific analysis for numeric parameters; it is a standard safety analysis addition.

reasoning: The Generated SAP accurately captures the majority of the clinical laboratory analysis requirements, including the use of CTCAE v5.0, handling of unscheduled visits, and descriptive statistics for hematology and chemistry. It correctly lists the specific parameters based on the Protocol. However, it explicitly contradicts the Original SAP regarding Coagulation and Urinalysis. The Original SAP requires descriptive statistics for numeric urinalysis and coagulation, and shift tables for non-numeric urinalysis. The Generated SAP restricts all urinalysis and coagulation data to listings only. Additionally, the Generated SAP omits the requirement for shift tables by 'each study period' (Induction, Maintenance), mentioning only the Whole Study Period. These are minor reductions in scope for safety reporting but constitute clear contradictions.
summary: The Generated SAP is largely accurate but contains a minor contradiction regarding the analysis of Coagulation and Urinalysis, restricting them to listings only despite the Original SAP requiring summaries. It also omits the requirement for period-specific shift tables.
